description: The AI Interpretation Layer subsystem is primarily defined by the `agents` package. It is the overarching core intelligence component that orchestrates AI-driven analysis, interprets LLM responses, and derives architectural insights. It acts as a multi-agent system, transforming raw LLM outputs and static analysis data into structured architectural knowledge, aligning with the project's AI-centric and pipeline-driven architectural bias.

components.name: AI Interpretation Layer
components.description: The overarching core intelligence component that orchestrates AI-driven analysis, interprets LLM responses, and derives architectural insights. It acts as a multi-agent system, transforming raw LLM outputs and static analysis data into structured architectural knowledge.

components.name: Agent
components.description: Serves as the foundational base class or interface for all specialized agents within this layer, defining common methods and properties for agent behavior.

components.name: MetaAgent
components.description: The primary orchestrator of the AI Interpretation Layer. It receives LLM responses and static analysis data, then delegates tasks to other agents to achieve comprehensive architectural insights, managing the overall workflow and interpretation strategy.

components.name: AbstractionAgent
components.description: Responsible for synthesizing high-level architectural patterns, components, and relationships from raw LLM interpretations and static analysis data, focusing on deriving abstract insights.

components.name: DetailsAgent
components.description: Extracts granular, specific details from LLM responses and code, complementing the AbstractionAgent by providing supporting evidence or finer-grained information.

components.name: PlannerAgent
components.description: Determines the optimal sequence of analysis steps and the overall strategy for interpreting LLM responses, guiding the MetaAgent's orchestration.

components.name: ValidatorAgent
components.description: Responsible for reviewing and validating the architectural insights generated by other agents, ensuring accuracy, consistency, and completeness against static analysis data and predefined rules.

components.name: Unclassified
components.description: Component for all unclassified files and utility functions (Utility functions/External Libraries/Dependencies)
